availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Calvin G. Couch (Hopkins County, KY, merchant's clerk )

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, postmaster and clerk. Virginia native. Married to Irena A. Couch. Father of Laura Couch. Postmaster of Ashbysburg in Hopkins County, Kentucky, from May 26, 1851, to January 8, 1852. Merchant's clerk for Powhatan M. Robertson in Hopkins County in 1850. Household owned fourteen enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1850. Clerk in Hopkins County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Hopkins County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 52A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 1, p. 695.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 640.

"Calvin G. Couch (1829-1887)," Find A Grave, Memorial #87698537, accessed September 30, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87698537.
Record of Appointment of Postmasters, 1832-1971 Records of the Post Office Department, NARA Series M841, RG 28, Hopkins County, Kentucky, vol. 14, p. 645.
